episodes.title: The Real Story Behind Wayward: My Time Inside the School That Inspired a Netflix Nightmare
episodes.description: Everyone’s talking about Netflix’s new series Wayward — but for me, it’s not just entertainment. It’s my life story. In this deeply personal episode, I break down what’s real and what’s made for TV in the hit series — because I actually lived it. Long before Wayward became a pop culture obsession, I attended CEDU, the original “therapeutic boarding school” that inspired this world. I graduated from its first campus, endured its methods, and witnessed firsthand how a program built on healing was actually rooted in Synanon, a 1960s cult known for psychological control and emotional abuse. Watching Wayward sent me into full-blown PTSD — not because it’s fiction, but because it’s frighteningly accurate. If you’ve been bingeing the series and find yourself wondering how much of it could really happen… this episode is for you. 💡 In this episode, you’ll hear: • What was real in Wayward — and what was dramatized for TV • The shocking history of CEDU, the program that inspired an entire industry of “troubled teen” schools • How the Synanon cult shaped the foundation of emotional-growth education • The disturbing practices that students endured in the name of therapy • The lasting trauma — and what healing looks like when you finally tell the truth --- --- --- PLEASE LIKE, SHARE, SUBSCRIBE, AND GIVE US A 5-STAR REVIEW!: ratethispodcast.com/missunderstood Become a Patreon Member: https://www.patreon.com/c/MissUnderstoodwithRachelUchitel Shop Miss Understood Merch https://missumerch.com/ ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Follow Rachel on Instagram!⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ https://www.instagram.com/racheluchitelnyc/?hl=en Follow Rachel on TikTok! https://www.tiktok.com/@itsracheluchitel Executive Producer: ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠George Carmona Support this podcast at — https://redcircle.com/miss-understood-with-rachel-uchitel/exclusive-content Advertising Inquiries: https://redcircle.com/brands Privacy & Opt-Out: https://redcircle.com/privacy

episodes.title: The Girl with the Duck Tattoo — Sarma Melngailis Writes her Own Story After "Bad Vegan"
episodes.description: She had a thriving restaurant, a cult following, and a mission to change the way people eat. Then, almost overnight, Sarma Melngailis became the woman at the center of Bad Vegan — a Netflix scandal that made headlines but missed the real story. Now, in her brand-new memoir The Girl with the Duck Tattoo, Sarma is reclaiming the narrative. And in this in-person interview — recorded live in New York City — she opens up to me like never before. This episode isn’t about viral fame or courtroom drama. It’s about the slow unraveling of identity, how coercive control works, what it takes to survive psychological abuse, and how one woman is writing her way back to herself. 💡 Why it matters: This isn’t just a story about scandal. It’s a story about control, recovery, and how smart women can still be broken down — and also built back up. ⸻ 🔗 CONNECT WITH SARMA 📘 The Girl with the Duck Tattoo – https://www.amazon.com/Girl-Duck-Tattoo-Memoir/dp/1544548982 📸 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/sarmamelngailis/ ⸻ ❤️ Loved this conversation?
